column4: um an "ubuntu" way would be no gcc at all so I wouldn't worry about it
That's a lame answer.  Ubuntu doesn't say you can't compile things, it just doesn't make you.  It does however, give you packages for gcc, it should give me a way to select which to use.
the concept of an "ubuntu" way is a lame one to begin with, I was merely demonstrating that
do what you want so long as it works
